meanings.definition: A charge of wrongdoing; a formal charge of criminal activity.
meanings.sent1: The accusations against him were serious.
meanings.sent2: She made accusations of theft against her coworker.
meanings.sent3: The accusations of the cat stealing the dog's bone were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The accusations of cheating in the game were like arrows hitting his reputation.
meanings.sent5: The accusations echoed in the courtroom, painting a picture of guilt.

meanings.definition: A claim that someone has done something wrong or illegal.
meanings.sent1: He faced accusations of lying about his whereabouts.
meanings.sent2: The accusations of fraud led to a thorough investigation.
meanings.sent3: The accusations of the cookie jar thief were met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her accusations of betrayal cut deeper than any knife.
meanings.sent5: The accusations lingered in the air, staining his reputation.
